channel.title: Getting Started on Amplify / AppSync / React Workshop
channel.description: Recent content in Getting Started on Amplify / AppSync / React Workshop

item.title: What We'll Build
item.description: Our Goal In this workshop, we’ll build an app with quite a few features, including: Allowing user sign up and authentication, so we know who owns which photo albums Building an API server, so our front end has a way to load the appropriate albums and photos to show a given user Storing data about albums, photos, and permissions of who can view what, so that our API has a fast and reliable place to query and save data to

item.title: Bootstrapping the App
item.description: Creating a React app We’ll get things started by building a new React web app using the create-react-app CLI tool. This will give us a sample React app with a local auto-reloading web server and some helpful transpiling support for the browser like letting us use async/await keywords, arrow functions, and more. You can learn more about create-react-app at https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app. In the Cloud9 terminal, run npx create-react-app photo-albums, then navigate to the newly created directory cd photo-albums
